intro: Picris globulifera, commonly known as the globe thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads that resemble small globes, giving it its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers in early summer, which are surrounded by bracts that form a protective layer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Botanically, it belongs to the family Asteraceae, also known as the daisy or sunflower family.
